howItWorks.headline: Deployed in Weeks, Not Months
howItWorks.description: No complex ceiling infrastructure. No IT firewall battles. No six-month implementation timelines.

step1.title: Tag
step1.description: Attach lightweight, battery-free labels to your equipment. Takes seconds per device. No charging, no pairing, no maintenance schedule.

step2.title: Connect
step2.description: Install a small number of powered gateways — typically 1-2 per floor. They communicate with tags using long-range, low-power signals.

step3.title: Track
step3.description: Access equipment locations through a clean web dashboard or mobile app. Search naturally: "Where are the available IV pumps on 3 North?"

howItWorks.timeline: Typical pilot deployment: 2-4 weeks from kickoff to live data

section1.headline: Zero Battery Maintenance. Ever.
section1.description: Our tags use photovoltaic cells powered by ambient indoor light, storing energy in carbon-based supercapacitors. No lithium batteries to replace. No maintenance schedules to manage. No dead tags creating blind spots.
section1.highlight: The only carbon-based supercapacitor solution — recyclable and sustainable.

section2.headline: 1-2 Gateways Per Floor. Entire Hospital Coverage.
section2.description: Long-range communication means fewer access points, simpler installation, and less IT coordination. Cover more area with less infrastructure.
section2.highlight: Compare to traditional RTLS: 10-20+ access points per floor.

section3.headline: Ask Questions. Get Answers.
section3.description: Our AI-powered mobile assistant understands natural language. Ask "Where's the nearest portable ultrasound?" and get instant answers. No complex menus or search filters.
section3.highlight: Built for clinical workflows, not IT departments.

hero.headline: Built by doctors. For doctors.
hero.subheadline: MediMind was founded alongside practicing physicians, surgeons, and healthcare professionals to solve real problems inside hospitals and clinics — not hypothetical ones.

medimind.headline: Why MediMind exists
medimind.paragraph1: Most healthcare software is built by people who have never worked a shift in a hospital. The result is systems that look good in demos but create friction in practice. Workflows that make sense on a whiteboard but fall apart at 3 AM when a nurse needs to find an IV pump.
medimind.paragraph2: MediMind started differently. Our founders spent years working in clinical environments, observing the gap between how healthcare systems actually function and how technology vendors assume they work. We saw the workarounds. The frustration. The wasted time.
medimind.paragraph3: So we built a company around a simple principle: involve clinicians from the start — not as focus group participants, but as partners, advisors, and co-builders. Every product decision is informed by people who understand the reality of patient care.

sense.headline: Introducing MediMind Sense
sense.paragraph1: MediMind Sense is our real-time asset visibility platform. It helps clinical and operations teams know where mobile medical equipment is, how it's being used, and whether they have the right amount.
sense.paragraph2: The idea came directly from hospital floors. We watched staff spend significant portions of their shifts searching for wheelchairs, IV pumps, and portable monitors. We saw departments hoarding equipment out of fear they wouldn't find it when needed. We documented the workarounds, the radio calls, the frustration.
sense.paragraph3: Sense was designed to solve this without adding burden. Battery-free tags that require no maintenance. Minimal infrastructure that deploys in weeks. A simple interface that works the way clinicians think — not the way IT systems are typically organized.

clinicians.headline: Built with clinicians, not just for them
clinicians.paragraph1: Thirteen practicing doctors serve as advisors, seed investors, and active contributors to MediMind. They aren't names on a website. They participate in product reviews, challenge our assumptions, and ensure we stay grounded in clinical reality.
clinicians.paragraph2: These physicians represent different specialties — from emergency medicine to surgery to internal medicine. They work in different hospital systems across different countries. This diversity means we hear multiple perspectives on every decision we make.
clinicians.paragraph3: When we debate a feature, a doctor is in the room. When we design a workflow, we test it with people who will actually use it. This isn't a marketing message — it's how we work.

advisors.headline: Clinical Advisors & Co-Builders
advisors.intro: Our clinical advisory network includes physicians from multiple specialties who contribute their expertise, invest their time, and help shape the platform based on real-world clinical experience.

closing.headline: Building carefully, for the long term
closing.paragraph: Healthcare moves slowly for good reasons. Patient safety, regulatory requirements, and institutional complexity all demand careful, thoughtful approaches. We're not trying to disrupt healthcare — we're trying to make it work a little better, one practical improvement at a time. That means building responsibly, listening closely, and earning trust through results rather than promises.
